item.title: Decent Dwarf Cannon
item.dc:creator: @haloofpower haloofpower
item.description:
@haloofpower wrote:

AtomicInt_:

Getters and setters are not needed for private local variables. e.g: in your constructor setPlayer(player); ~> this.player = player;

Not needed, but I still like it. I prefer the getter and setter.

Actually, to that idiot that likes to make long posts, I originated from Moparscape and moved to a different community because I didn’t like the incompetence level here.

Except in that entire class, you are not serializing, or deserializing anything.

Read full topic

item.title: Decent Dwarf Cannon
item.dc:creator: @haloofpower haloofpower
item.description:
@haloofpower wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:15, topic:465482”][quote author=haloofpower link=topic=570753.msg4135321#msg4135321 date=1351635953]

what does the ‘Serializable’ Interface do?

Serialization is the conversion of an object to a series of bytes, so that the object can be easily saved to persistent storage or streamed across a communication link. The byte stream can then be deserialised - converted into a replica of the original object.

I believe he was asking the OP, in order to discern whether this is actually his code or not.

That would prove nothing as to whether it’s my code or not you ignorant fool.

Also, updated to latest version (Meaning I added something).

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FUxSCOf7Jyc

Watch that video for you skeptics who think I didn’t make it.

That still does not prove that the code is yours. It just shows it’s function in game, not that you are the author. Why are you using serializable? Why do you have empty comment blocks? Those are things that competent programmers don’t do.

And even then, from viewing the video, you can tell that your code is flawed, as there are 3 rock crabs, that are well within range, that aren’t even being touched.

The shots are done based on tiles, and if they aren’t in that set area of tiles, no firing. Basically, the shots don’t go to every tile, only a set few. And it also goes by size, if they’re close enough the shot doesn’t shoot at the npc because they’re too close.

I use serializable to save it to each player class and so that it can be called and directly run from the player class. I have empty comment blocks because when I created the class (I use an IDE) it added those and I never felt like removing it.

Also, just to spite you more, I will show the project threads and releases I’ve made under the name Orient and the project Prometheus.

http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs-503-client-server/snippets/450214-decent-dwarf-cannon.html

http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs-503-client-server/snippets/450106-useful-grand-exchange-snippets.html

http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs-503-client-server/projects/431980-prometheus-project-718-a.html

http://www.rune-server.org/programming/website-development/433481-my-custom-login-registration-system-my-server.html

http://www.google.com/forums/showthread.php?80380-Prometheus-Project-718

http://www.google.com/forums/showthread.php?83042-Dwarf-MultiCannon

http://www.google.com/forums/showthread.php?83041-Useful-Grand-Exchange-Snippets

http://www.rspscoding.org/forum/index.php?/topic/6104-decent-dwarf-cannon/page__view__findpost__p__71006

http://www.rspscoding.org/forum/index.php?/topic/6103-useful-grand-exchange-snippets/page__view__findpost__p__71005

Oh! Yeah, here’s the website I use for integration. http://orient-hq.com

Need more proof or are you going to continue to be a jack ass?
[/quote]

Why are you saving a cannon state to each serialized player object? When the player logs out, the server should remove the cannon, and add it to their inventory before saving the file. And when they login, the cannon shouldn’t be rebuilt.

Overall, there is definitely room for improvement, in terms of both design, and function.

Also, those still don’t prove that you’re “Orient”. You just linked to a bunch of topics made by that person, but I won’t split hairs.[/quote]
Go ahead, ask the moderators of all those sites to cross-check my IP address. Go ahead, go on, idiot.

Also, it does remove it, it’s serializeable so the variables defined in the class only pertain to that single user. Yet again, idiot.

Rodgerwilco:

If a player logs out, the cannon should be lost

The cannon is lost you ignorant bastard. This saves the cannon when used so that the variables in the class only pertain to the user. If you looked at the class you would know it DOES that.

Read full topic
